block.p: International Olympic Committee, Lausanne, Switzerland, chose the United Group, part of the WPP Group, as its creative agency. Spending was estimated at $125 million. A review included the incumbent, Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe, which created ads for the 2004 and 2006 Olympics.

Chili's Grill and Bar, part of Brinker International, Dallas, placed its creative account in review after having spent almost 20 years with GSD&M, Austin, Tex., part of the Omnicom Group. Spending was estimated at $120 million. GSD&M, which created campaigns like the ''I Want My Baby Back'' ads for baby-back ribs, will not take part in the review.

Weight Watchers International, New York, named McCann Erickson Worldwide, New York, part of the McCann Worldgroup unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its creative account. The assignment, with spending estimated at $70 million, had been at Y&R Advertising, New York, part of the Young & Rubicam Brands division of the WPP Group.
